verification_notes: The argument shape (prove both divisibilities via equivariance + irreducibility) is standard, but this step is not fully rigorous as stated. In Direction 2, irreducibility must be for the GL_n-module containing \(\phi\), so that the cyclic subrepresentation generated by nonzero \(\phi\) is all of \(V\), and each \(\phi'\) used in linearity is a finite linear combination of translates. Also, GL_n-equivariance typically yields \(L_{R(g)\phi}=u_g(s)L_\phi\) with a unit \(u_g(s)\), not necessarily literal equality; ideal equality follows only after noting unit factors do not change fractional ideals. Finally, divisibility notation \(L\mid L_\phi\) and \(L_\phi\mid L\) needs the ambient coefficient ring/fractional-ideal convention to be explicit.
